intro: Hieracium rigidum subsp. melanographum, commonly known as the black-stained hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and hairy stems, which are often tinged with a dark coloration. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the Asteraceae family. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. This subspecies is notable for its unique pigmentation and is often found in grassy habitats and disturbed soils.
